nodes.text: The most plausible explanation of the origin of the disciples' belief therefore is that Jesus really did rise from the dead.
the Jewish concept of resurrection was radically different than Jesus' resurrection
As the reknowned New Testament scholar Joachim Jeremias puts it  Nowhere does one find in the literature [of ancient Judaism] anything comparable to the resurrection of Jesus.
If you deny that Jesus really did rise from the dead then you've got to explain the origin of the disciples' belief either in terms of Jewish influences or Christian influences.
But neither can it be explained from the side of Jewish influences
it couldn't have come from Christian influences
